title: Project Manager
description:
**Project Manager**
===================

Apply
**Project Manager**
===================

* Agency: DEPT OF DESIGN & CONSTRUCTION
Posted on: 08/13/2024
* Job type: Full-time
Location


QUEENS


* Title Classification: Exam may be required
Department


PUB BLDGS/A+E/ENGINEERING


Salary range: $64,242.00 – $73,878.00
**Job Description**
-------------------


Hours: Full Time- 35 Hours  

Work Location: 30-30 Thomson Avenue, LIC, NY 11101
  

  

All interested candidates are welcome to apply and will be considered for an interview based on the Minimum Qualification Requirements. Please indicate on your cover letter if you are permanent in the Assistant Civil Engineer title or if you are on the Open-Competitive List for Exam #1101. If you do not meet the previously mentioned civil service criteria, you are required to file for Open-Competitive Exam #5015, which will be available for filing on the NYC Department of Citywide Administrative Services webpage on August 7, 2024.
  

  

For more information and to apply for the Civil Engineer Exam, visit https://a856-exams.nyc.gov/OASysWeb/home .  

  

The NYC Department of Design and Construction, Public Buildings Division, Architecture & Engineering-Engineering Unit seeks an Assistant Civil Engineer.
  

  

Under general supervision, the duties for this position will include, but not be limited to project scoping, design and/or review of consultant drawings and specifications (utilizing Blue-Beam), site inspections, generating reports, ad hoc technical investigations; in-house design (utilizing AutoCAD and BIM) and providing support services for client-agency projects.
  

  

Duties may also include reviewing and developing drawings, writing specifications and preparing estimates of quantities; checking shop drawings; participating in inspection operations by observing, checking and certifying the installation of materials and equipment, reviewing or examining plans for the construction, demolition or alteration of structures to comply with the provisions of law, rule or regulation.
  

  

The candidate will also interface with clients, consultants, contractors, and other technical staff. Some of the physical activities performed by Assistant Civil Engineers and environmental conditions experienced are walking to and from inspection sites and during inspections; climbing and descending ladders or stairs to get to areas to be inspected; standing for an extended period; bending and stooping during inspections; working in confined areas.  

  

Authorization to work in the United States is required for this position. NYC Department of Design and Construction does not provide sponsorship for international employees for visa applications, extensions or status changes, including STEM/OPT visas. Applicants are responsible for ensuring that they meet all qualifying requirements for this position, at the time of application.  

  

All applicants, including City Employees:  

Please go to NYC Government Jobs | Explore Careers | City of New York, go to Search for Open Jobs, and type in the Job ID # listed above. Submit job application as prompted. Do not apply via Employee Self-Service (ESS), e-mail, mail, or fax your resume to DDC directly.

  

Minimum Qualifications  

1. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college in civil engineering and one year of full-time satisfactory experience in civil engineering work; or  

  

2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and a Master's degree from an accredited college in civil engineering.

  

Preferred Skills  

Candidate should possess excellent organizational, verbal, and written skills, with the ability to multi-task various projects. Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Bluebeam, and AutoCAD is preferred.  


55a Program  

This position is also open to qualified persons with a disability who are eligible for the 55-a Program. Please indicate at the top of your resume and cover letter that you would like to be considered for the position through the 55-a Program.  


Public Service Loan Forgiveness  

As a prospective employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for federal loan forgiveness programs and state repayment assistance programs. For more information, please visit the U.S. Department of Education’s website at https://studentaid.gov/pslf/.

New York City Residency is not required for this position.

title: COMMUNITY ASSOCIATE, FAMILY PARTNERSHIPS
description:
**COMMUNITY ASSOCIATE, FAMILY PARTNERSHIPS**
============================================

Apply
**COMMUNITY ASSOCIATE, FAMILY PARTNERSHIPS**
============================================

* Agency: NYC HOUSING AUTHORITY
Posted on: 08/13/2024
* Job type: Full-time
Location


BROOKLYN


* Title Classification: No exam required
Department


Family Partnerships


Salary range: $43,143.00 – $49,837.00
**Job Description**
-------------------


The New York City Housing Authority's Department of Resident Services, Partnerships, and Initiatives (RSPI) engages NYCHA residents in critical programs, services, and initiatives in the areas of economic opportunity, youth, senior and social services. RSPI also supports NYCHA’s extensive network of Resident Associations; and connects residents to opportunities such as financial empowerment, business development, career advancement, and educational programs. RSPI has set forth a model of engagement that effectively serves residents as well as internal and external stakeholders to create a comprehensive engagement model that supports residents and NYCHA’s strategic plan for preservation and advances the work of the agency.  

  

Family Partnerships Department (FPD), one of RSPI's six units, manages partnerships with external providers and City agencies offering youth, senior, and social services. FPD connects residents to critical services and implements programs and policies that support household stability and tenancy, individual advancement, and aging-in-place.  

  

RSPI seeks an experienced individual to support its Family Partnerships' team. Reporting to the Unit's Supervisor, the Community Associate’s responsibilities will include, but are not limited to the following:  

  

1. Under the guidance of a supervisor, develop plans to provide residents with appropriate social services; employ an early intervention, preventive focused, case management approach.
  

2. Under the guidance of a supervisor, employ a home visit model to conduct assessments and determine service needs.  

3. When needed, conduct in-person and over the phone pre-screening of NYCHA residents to make appropriate referrals to formal and informal partners.  

4. Prepare and maintain case records, and written reports in the Family Partnerships Case Management Services’ (FPCMS) database.  

5. Coordinate services, connecting residents to support systems through direct referral and outreach.
  

6. Develop and maintain collaborative partnerships with NYCHA staff and community-based organizations to have a thorough understanding of citywide, borough-wide, and development-specific programs, and thus ensure the best possible referrals and outcomes.
  

7. Identify, establish, maintain, and share new resources, with supervisory guidance.  

8. Assist with completing key documentation, performing data entry and following up on referrals, as appropriate. Utilize the FSCMS and database systems to document, track and make referrals for services relevant to residents’ needs.  

9. Coordinate off-site and on-site information sessions; perform telephone outreach and tabling at NYCHA and other community events to share information about services available to residents.
  

10. Perform other related duties as needed.  

  

Additional Information  

  

1. NYCHA employees applying for promotional, title or level change opportunities must have served a period of one year at current location and in current title and level (if applicable).  

2. NYCHA residents are encouraged to apply.  

  

Please read this posting carefully to make certain you meet the qualification requirements before applying to this position.

  

Minimum Qualifications  

Qualification Requirements
  

1. High school graduation or equivalent and three years of experience in community work or community centered activities in an area related to duties described above; or
  

2. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" above.

  

Preferred Skills  

1. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. 2. Effective skills in engaging residents. 3. Ability to interface with service providers from all sectors of the service system. 4. Excellent organizational skills. 5. Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams. 6. Experience in MS Office - Access, Excel, PowerPoint, and Word. 7. Bilingual a plus.

As a prospective employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for federal loan forgiveness programs and state repayment assistance programs. For more information, please visit the U.S. Department of Education’s website at https://studentaid.gov/pslf/.

title: Examiner
description:
**Examiner**
============

Apply
**Examiner**
============

* Agency: DEPT OF CITYWIDE ADMIN SVCS
Posted on: 08/13/2024
* Job type: Full-time
Location


NYC-ALL BOROS


* Title Classification: Exam may be required
Department


Exam Development Group


Salary range: $67,972.00 – $78,168.00
**Job Description**
-------------------


About DCAS  

DCAS's mission is to make city government work for all New Yorkers. From managing New York City’s most iconic courthouses and municipal buildings, to purchasing over $1 billion annually in goods and services for more than 80 City agencies what we do ensures that all agencies can deliver on their mission. Our reach touches every facet of city government and is instrumental to the successful day-to-day operations of the City of New York.
  

  

Our commitment to equity, effectiveness, and sustainability guides our work providing City agencies with the critical resources and support needed to succeed, including:
  

* Recruiting, hiring, and training City employees.
* Managing 55 public buildings.
* Acquiring, selling, and leasing City property.
* Purchasing over $1 billion in goods and services for City agencies.
* Overseeing the greenest municipal vehicle fleet in the country.
* Leading the City's efforts to reduce carbon emissions from government operations.

  

When you work at DCAS, you're not just working for one agency, but in service of them all. It's an opportunity to provide impactful support, quality customer service, and help protect the future of New York City for generations to come. Visit our website at nyc.gov/dcas to learn more about the work we do.  

  

Job Description  

The New York City Department of Citywide Administrative Services (DCAS), Human Capital Line of Service, Bureau of Examinations performs responsible work in the establishment of qualifications for civil service positions, as well as in the development, validation, rating and administration of competitive civil service examinations, and certification of lists of eligible applicants.  

  

The Exam Development Unit, within the Bureau of Examinations, is responsible for collaborating with City Agencies in the development of civil service exams for competitive class titles by working with City Agencies’ Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to conduct in depth job analyses. These job analyses are used to develop rating guides and questions which may appear on civil service examinations and are used to determine candidate eligibility on distinct lists for the respective civil service title.
  

  

The Bureau of Examinations also employs Special Examiners (Physical Tests) to perform professional work in the administration of physical ability tests under direct supervision. Physical Tests are scheduled around the physical testing needs of City Agencies and typically occur twice annually each for a period of approximately three months, and each round will be administered to approximately 3,000 candidates. At the end of each physical test round, assignments are concluded until the next physical test round is held.  

  

The Exam Development Unit seeks to appoint one (1) Tests & Measurement Specialist, Level II who will be responsible for, but not limited to, the following tasks:
  

* Conduct field observations and interviews to identify the essential functions of job titles;
* Create and administer job analysis questionnaires and linking surveys;
* Analyze questionnaire and survey data to create test plans;
* Develop, administer, and rate tests for employment and promotion in a variety of NYC government agencies under DCAS jurisdiction, and other City agencies including Health + Hospitals and CUNY;
* Serve as the primary contact for all Physical Tests, including coordinating all Physical Tests and supervising the Special Examiners (Physical Tests); and
* Perform related duties.
  

Minimum Qualifications  

1. A master's degree in psychology or a related field from an accredited college including or supplemented by at least 12 credits in any combination of two or more of the following course areas: tests and measurement, statistics, research, personnel psychology, and computers; or  

  

2. Completion of at least 45 credits towards a master's degree in psychology or a related field from an accredited college including or supplemented by at least 12 specialized credits as described in "1" above; or  

  

3. A baccalaureate degree in psychology or a related field from an accredited college including or supplemented by at least 12 specialized credits as described in "1" above, and two years of satisfactory full-time professional experience in the development of personnel selection tests; or  

  

4. Education and/or experience equivalent to "1", "2" or "3" above. However, all candidates must possess a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and the 12 specialized credits as described in "1" above.  

  

Special Note  

To be eligible for placement in Assignment Level II or III, individuals must have, after meeting the minimum requirements, either one year of experience in performing professional testing and measurement work, or possess a doctorate in psychology, statistics, educational research, or a related field.

  

Preferred Skills  

- Able to organize work and provide a high level of time management and planning. - Excellent and effective communication skills (written and oral), including the ability to understand and be understood in English. - Possess strong attention to details. - Able to compile, prepare and analyze reports using electronic databases - Strong desire to work with diverse groups of people to creatively develop exams. - Strong computer skills, including experience with the Microsoft Suite and SPSS. - Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic work atmosphere to be able to successfully handle multiple activities. - Able to work well within a team, meet deadlines, analyze problems, and handle potentially difficult situations.  


55a Program  

This position is also open to qualified persons with a disability who are eligible for the 55-a Program. Please indicate at the top of your resume and cover letter that you would like to be considered for the position through the 55-a Program.  


Public Service Loan Forgiveness  

As a prospective employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for federal loan forgiveness programs and state repayment assistance programs. For more information, please visit the U.S. Department of Education’s website at https://studentaid.gov/pslf/.  


Residency Requirement  

New York City Residency is not required for this position  


Additional Information  

The City of New York is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy.

  

Minimum Qualifications  

1. A master's degree in psychology or a related field from an accredited college including or supplemented by at least 12 credits in any combination of two or more of the following course areas: tests and measurement, statistics, research, personnel psychology, and computers; or  

  

2. Completion of at least 45 credits towards a master's degree in psychology or a related field from an accredited college including or supplemented by at least 12 specialized credits as described in \\"1\\" above; or  

  

3. A baccalaureate degree in psychology or a related field from an accredited college including or supplemented by at least 12 specialized credits as described in \\"1\\" above, and two years of satisfactory full-time professional experience in the development of personnel selection tests; or  

  

4. Education and/or experience equivalent to \\"1\\", \\"2\\" or \\"3\\" above. However, all candidates must possess a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and the 12 specialized credits as described in \\"1\\" above.  

  

Special Note  

To be eligible for placement in Assignment Level II or III, individuals must have, after meeting the minimum requirements, either one year of experience in performing professional testing and measurement work, or possess a doctorate in psychology, statistics, educational research, or a related field.

  

Preferred Skills  

* \\tAble to organize work and provide a high level of time management and planning.\\n-\\tExcellent and effective communication skills (written and oral), including the ability to understand and be understood in English.\\n-\\tPossess strong attention to details.\\n-\\tAble to compile, prepare and analyze reports using electronic databases\\n-\\tStrong desire to work with diverse groups of people to creatively develop exams. \\n-\\tStrong computer skills, including experience with the Microsoft Suite and SPSS. \\n-\\tComfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic work atmosphere to be able to successfully handle multiple activities.\\n-\\tAble to work well within a team, meet deadlines, analyze problems, and handle potentially difficult situations.


55a Program  

This position is also open to qualified persons with a disability who are eligible for the 55-a Program. Please indicate at the top of your resume and cover letter that you would like to be considered for the position through the 55-a Program.  


Public Service Loan Forgiveness  

As a prospective employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for federal loan forgiveness programs and state repayment assistance programs. For more information, please visit the U.S. Department of Education’s website at https://studentaid.gov/pslf/.  


Residency Requirement  

New York City Residency is not required for this position  


Additional Information  

The City of New York is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy.

title: Soccer Instructor for Preschool Programs
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Competitive salary
* Flexible schedule
* Free uniforms
* Opportunity for advancement
* Training & development

  

**Our Company:**  

If you have a passion for soccer and want to positively impact children’s lives, then let’s connect today! Soccer Shots is an engaging children’s soccer program with a focus on character development. We offer a Traditional Program to meet the developmental needs of children ages 2-8. We also offer an Empower Program, which provides children with disabilities a safe place to learn and grow and have fun with the game of soccer. With 10 plus years’ experience, we serve children in Morris, Hunterdon, Somerset, Middlesex, Mercer, Ocean, Atlantic, Cape May, Cumberland, and Salem Counties. Our vision is to provide a beloved growth experience for every child, a remarkable experience for every family. We maintain a caring and family work culture.  

  

**Job Description:**  

 Soccer Shots is looking for passionate, part-time instructors to serve children ages 2-5 in various preschools/daycare settings we run during weekday mornings and/or afternoons. We offer a competitive rate per session of $15-$30 based on experience with opportunities of advancement. Our seasons run 10-12 weeks, with the option of working all year round.  

  

**What you get:**  

* Flexible scheduling according to your availability and based on what sessions are needed
* Weekday mornings/afternoons/early evenings and weekend mornings are all available
* Great Company Culture and Growth Potential
* Thorough training and curriculum provided
* Uniform and equipment necessary to coach


  

**Requirements:**  

* Transportation-you are responsible for getting to and from the location of the session
* Soccer experience preferred but not mandatory
* Caring, engaging each child through positive affirmation
* Energetic by creating a fun and exciting atmosphere that leads a child to smile and


 participate.

4. Education and/or experience equivalent to "1", "2" or "3" above. However, all candidates must possess a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and the 12 specialized credits as described in "1" above.  

  

Special Note  

To be eligible for placement in Assignment Level II or III, individuals must have, after meeting the minimum requirements, either one year of experience in performing professional testing and measurement work, or possess a doctorate in psychology, statistics, educational research, or a related field.

  

Preferred Skills  

- Able to organize work and provide a high level of time management and planning. - Excellent and effective communication skills (written and oral), including the ability to understand and be understood in English. - Possess strong attention to details. - Able to compile, prepare and analyze reports using electronic databases - Strong desire to work with diverse groups of people to creatively develop exams. - Strong computer skills, including experience with the Microsoft Suite and SPSS. - Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic work atmosphere to be able to successfully handle multiple activities. - Able to work well within a team, meet deadlines, analyze problems, and handle potentially difficult situations  


55a Program  

This position is also open to qualified persons with a disability who are eligible for the 55-a Program. Please indicate at the top of your resume and cover letter that you would like to be considered for the position through the 55-a Program.

title: Live In Nanny
description:
A lovely family in New Rochelle, NY is seeking a LIVE IN NANNY to support their family. This very warm, kind and thoughtful family consists of Mom, Dad and three children - five year old twins, who are in school during the day, and a 17 month old toddler who is at home. The primary responsibility of this role is to be a support for the family in whatever way is needed, and the focus of your day will be caring for the 17 month old. Supporting the family will also mean assisting Mom and Dad before and after school with the twins, cleaning and maintaining the home while the 17 month old is napping, and generally being another set of hands to help things run smoothly for the family. The family is truly one of the most thoughtful and kind I have met, and it is of critical importance to them that the person working in this role is happy, does not feel that the workload is too challenging, and will speak with them if there are any points of stress or issues they are experiencing in the role. They truly want their nanny to feel supported and happy in her work.

Location: New Rochelle, NY

Schedule: Monday - Friday

Salary: $800 -$900/week, based on experience

Benefits: Paid Holiday, PTO and Paid Vacations

Responsibilities:

* Assisting the parent where needed, including with the care of the children and of the home
* The primary responsibility in your day will be the care of the 17 month old, including feeding, sleep schedule, and stimulating the child with age-appropriate activities. Developmental stimulation is very important to the family. You will be expected to take the child out of the home regularly to the park, events at local libraries and facilities, read books, engage in developmental play, etc.
* Driver preferred, so that you are able to take the 17 month old out of the house during the colder months with more ease. If you do not drive, please be comfortable with walking daily approx. 20 minutes to the library and other activities.
* Assisting parents before school and caring for after school the 5 year old twins, until the parents return from work
* Assisting with the dinner, bath and bed routine of all three children
* Light housekeeping is expected while the 17 month old is napping

Requirements:

* 2+ years of professional childcare experience, preferably in-home
* Conversational English
* Driver preferred
* References required
* A warm and giving heart, and the desire to communicate well with the family in an open and honest relationship

We can't wait to speak with you, apply now!

**How to Apply**: If you are excited about joining our family at Lincroft Music and believe you have what it takes to create a positive impact on our students, we would love to hear from you. Please send your resume, cover letter, and any other relevant materials to LincroftMusic@gmail.com

Come and be a part of something special at Lincroft Music, where teaching is a joy, and everyone is family. We can't wait to welcome you to our team!

https://www.lincroftmusic.com/music-teacher-jobs-new-jersey

**WHO IS LINCROFT MUSIC**: We are a family run music school, celebrating 21 years! We constantly have a waiting list. We are looking for someone to take on all the new students who are calling, which is an awesome opportunity to build a schedule of students starting fresh with you.

\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_

**Why Choose Lincroft Music**: At Lincroft Music, we pride ourselves on being more than just a music school – we are a family. When you join our team, you become a valued member of our close-knit community. We believe in creating a warm and welcoming environment where students, teachers, and staff feel supported, inspired, and encouraged to grow.

**What We Offer:**

**Fun and Creative Teaching Environment:** Join our vibrant and lively studio where teaching is a joyous experience. We believe in fostering creativity and imagination, allowing you to explore innovative teaching methods and bring out the best in your students.

**Supportive Community**: At Lincroft Music, we support one another like family. You'll be part of a team of dedicated professionals who collaborate, share ideas, and inspire each other. We celebrate individual achievements and offer support when challenges arise.

**Room for Growth**: We believe in providing more than just a job, we strive to provide a home for music teachers who want to be able to do more than teach their private lessons. Our teachers have opportunities to provide our students with specialized classes and workshops in their specialties. Many of our teachers have been here for many years, enjoying a comfortable home to earn in multiple ways.

Our school has a mission of social justice and service learning with a focus on individual learners. Our teachers teach within a framework aligned to the New Jersey Student Learning Standards, but have autonomy to create an inquiry-based, learner-centered curriculum.

title: Manager, Clinical Services
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**

**Triple C is a well-founded, grass-roots organization that has helped to make the dream of living independently with dignity become a reality for those they serve throughout Middlesex, Monmouth and Ocean counties. We are in growth mode and are looking for like-minded individuals who have a passion for people and want to contribute to our mission. To fulfill that goal, we are currently looking for a Clinical Services Manager to serve as the external face of Triple C in the community.** 

The Clinical Services Manager is responsible for the day to day supportive housing operations. This position coordinates activities with the services team, and interfaces with property management, facilities, and fiscal department(s) to ensure outstanding support for consumers served. Supervises assigned staff and provides strict oversight of administrative functions to support the services team.

The Clinical Services Manager, as part of a team, supports the coordination of referrals, processing placements, completing preliminary intake assessments, organizing comprehensive service planning and assisting with discharge to transition consumers to the community.

As per NJAC 10:37B-5.2 (c): duties *minimally* include: supervision of day to day service provision of non-clinical staff, contributing to the development, implementation, monitoring, and updating of the individualized rehabilitation plan; performing therapeutic rehabilitative skill development; offering services appropriate to meet the consumer’s needs; performing crisis intervention; and coordinating and managing services.

**BENEFITS:**

* 401(k)
* 403(b)
* Continuing education credits
* Credit union membership
* Disability insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Medical and Prescription – Platinum & Standard plan (85% of EE coverage paid by employer)
* Dental (100% of EE coverage paid by employer)
* Vision (100% of EE coverage paid by employer)
* Up to 13 Paid Holidays
* Begin with 20 Days of Paid Time Off
* Non-Contributory Pension Plan
* Ability to contribute to 403(b) retirement plan
* Qualified Non-profit Agency for Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF)
* Offers FREE in-house CEU credits provided by Relias

**Agency Perks and Discounts**

* Employee Assistance Program
* AT&T Employee Discount
* Flex Spending Accounts

The Home and Community-Based Services Loan Redemption Program is a new State initiative that will provide student loan redemption up to $50,000 to licensed health care, behavioral health, and social services professionals in exchange for a year of service at an eligible HCBS provider agency. Triple C Housing is confirmed as a program eligible agency.

Applications for the program are open and close on July 31st. Awards will be made on a first-come, first-served basis.

To learn more, please visit https://www.hesaa.org/Pages/HCBSPLRP.aspx.

title: Nanny/Babysitter needed!
description:
**Make a Positive Impact with us!** Apply with our backup care team! We are seeking a professional nanny with at least 2 years of experience who is available 2-3 full days a week, Monday through Friday. You must be willing to work with children of all ages and be professional, reliable, and caring. If you have a passion for childcare and meet these requirements, we'd like to hear from you!

Our team will schedule you via our personalized app and build your schedule out on a weekly basis.

Backup Care Nannying is where you will go to the homes of children from infants to teens and provide amazing care.

**Requirements:**

* **Monday - Friday availability - able to start as early as 7 am and stay as late as 6 pm if needed (you will know your schedule ahead of time)**
* **Able to work a minimum of 2 full days M-F**
* 2+ years of childcare experience (infants, preschoolers, toddlers, and/or elementary school-aged children). Your resume should reflect all your childcare experience
* 3-4 Relevant professional childcare references
* Stellar communication skills
* An energetic happy flexible attitude
* CPR Certification
* Driver’s License and car in most areas (NYC and SF it is not necessary)
* Must be 18 years of age or older

**Pay:**

$19 per hour paid bi-weekly via direct deposit. You will be a Crunch Care employee so you will receive an annual W2. Daily bonuses, plus OT.

**Perks:**

100 hours per month of employment required, an average of 23 hours per week:

* International Nanny Association Annual Membership and group access on Facebook
* Sick time pay pursuant to state and city mandates
* 2 extended education classes/trainings per year

150 hours per month of employment required (benefits above will be included):

* Health care stipend of $75 per month
* 401k After 1 year of service and 1,000 hours of work

**Company Description:**

Crunch Care was founded in 2006 and boasts a high retention rate among our nannies, caregivers, and domestic staff. Crunch Care provides custom solutions to families looking for domestic employees such as nannies, Night Nurses, Housekeepers, Household Managers, and Senior and Post-Surgical caregivers. We pride ourselves in our ability to fulfill almost any type of in-home care need. Our search services range from short-term sporadic and backup care needs to long-term placements and due diligence services. Our approach is hands-on and consultative, spending time getting to fully understand your family's needs and providing concise, professional referral services. Our nannies and caregivers go through a rigorous screening process, and only the most qualified candidates are accepted. We are the leading provider of quality nanny and domestic staffing services in Southern California, the San Francisco Bay Area, New York, Portland, Las Vegas, and Washington. We have a corporate recruiting culture, lending a more skilled and expert level of service to our clients, and providing reliable, safe, and experienced services. We screen and evaluate thousands of nannies, caregivers, and domestic employees annually staffing a diverse range of families. We like to think of ourselves as an extension of your family, striving to make your life a little easier when in need of child care or domestic services. We only represent the very best care providers in the field and pride ourselves on excellence.

\\*Pursuant to the San Francisco, Portland, New York, Los Angeles, Nevada Fair, Washington, and Arizona Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Paid Search Associate (80% remote)
description:
Do you enjoy looking at data and love to learn? Are you early in your career but looking for a challenging place to learn strategic SEM? If you are disenchanted by your entry-level role at an agency holding company and want to join a growing agency where your voice matters, look no further.

Silverlight Digital (SLD) is a boutique digital media agency based in NYC currently working from our homes but gathering semi-regularly at our New York City office. While our client base is primarily pharmaceutical, we have extensive knowledge of the media landscape across a variety of verticals. We help our clients find digital solutions that best fit their needs and provide regular analyses of campaign performance with clear explanations of how we used and will use data to inform campaign optimizations. We are hiring a Paid Search Associate who will be an integral part of the SLD team.

Responsibilities

* Manage search engine marketing campaigns on Google Ads (and sometimes Bing)
* SEM performance tracking, analysis, optimizations, and reporting
* Create ad copy and perform keyword research
* Set up testing, share results, determine next steps
* Manage and track spend across SEM campaigns, assist with monthly billing and reconciliation
* Own your search accounts while collaborating with the rest of the client team

Desired Skills and Experience

* 2-4 years of Paid Search experience (agency experience a plus)
* Google Ads experience
* Strong desire to build a career in digital media
* Advanced proficiency in Excel and high comfort level in PowerPoint
* Some experience in Google Analytics (Familiarity with Looker Studio a plus)
* Pharma knowledge is a nice bonus, but it’s not required
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal
* Must be able to handle multiple, competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
* Not easily ruffled and possesses good sense of humor
* Must work Eastern Time Zone hours
* Willingness to travel, if needed, for client meetings
* Client service mindset
* Bachelor’s degree required

SLD is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or other fascinating characteristics that make us unique. Visit us at www.silverlightdigital.com.

title: Mental Health Counselors
description:
Nassau Psychology PC is a vibrant, established, well-run, group psychotherapy practice in Nassau County. We're looking for a licensed Clinical Psychologist, Licensed Mental Health Counselor (LMHC), Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), or Licensed Marriage Family Therapist (LMFT) to join our team!

We offer healing, hope and possibilities for adults, adolescents, children and couples through psychotherapy and psychoeducation that recognize the value, strengths, and resources of all we serve. We are seeking experienced mental health providers who demonstrate the heart and skills needed to help our valued clients and who want to be a part of a flourishing team. Nassau Psychology helps therapists focus on therapy by taking care of the business side of a clinical practice.

We provide supervision, referrals, marketing, full billing and scheduling services, administrative support, beautifully furnished office suites and a fun and cohesive team of therapists. The Position is fee for service with reimbursement for any late cancellations and no shows. *This opportunity is ideal for the highly skilled therapist who would like to work in a thriving group practice setting while enjoying a full-spectrum compensation package including competitive pay, medical, dental & vision benefits , 401k matching, paid sick leave, professional development funds - - without the work, headaches, or financial investment of running a business.*

As a group, we strive to provide psychotherapy that deepens our clients understanding of themselves and their relationships. To that end, we use psychodynamic, gestalt, and family systems theories to deepen our work. At the same time, we strive to provide quick symptom relief, integrating the use of CBT, mindfulness and other practices in our work as well. We regularly consult with each other on cases and benefit from different perspectives. There are opportunities for peer-consultation, case conference and didactics as well.

**We are currently seeking full-time and part-time licensed therapists for our Wantagh, Cedarhurst, and Rockville Center locations.**

Full-time is considered to be 38 client hours per week including 3 evenings, or 2 evenings and Sunday for those who wish to work on Sunday.

Part-time work is considered to be a minimum of 20 hours per week including 2 evenings.

We are looking for therapists who can see diverse client populations and presenting issues. Experience working with couples is a plus, as well as experience working with children, but not a requirement. Ideal candidates possess the ability to conceptualize a case, understand underlying motivation and use a treatment model to drive treatment.

**Benefits for Licensed Therapists:**

* Medical, dental, and vision benefits for full-time staff
* Reimbursement funds for professional development training / CEU
* Paid Family Leave
* All employment taxes processed by Nassau Psychology
* Workers Comp & State Unemployment insurance provided
* Bi-monthly automatic bank deposits based on all sessions provided during the previous 2 weeks - (no need to wait for protracted insurance reimbursement)
* All credentialing with insurance companies is done by the practice
* All new patients are on boarded by our New Patient Coordinators (all paperwork, forms etc. are completed by our staff) so you can focus on doing therapy
* We have a very steady referral stream of clients to easily fill your caseload
* All billing of insurance is handled on your behalf
* Feel at ease in well-appointed therapy rooms
* Weekly consultation group
* Opportunities to offer supervision
* Dedicated clinical support and group consultations
* Thriving and connected professional team with year-round social events, sharing each other's successes and milestones and professional growth opportunities

**Minimum Requirements for Licensed Therapists:**

* Master's degree and independent professional license in New York State (including Licensed Mental Health Counselor, Licensed Clinical Social Worker and Licensed Clinical Psychologist).
* Availability for afternoon / evening work is helpful. Weekend availability is a plus. Part-time or full-time work available.
* Currently, we are not considering applicants who are an Associate or Provisional level of license.
* Enrollment on insurance panels is welcomed, but not required.

**For more information about our practice, you can visit our website:**

www.nassaupsychology.org

To apply, please forward a cover letter of interest and resume to the email linked to this posting. You will then be emailed a list of questions - and your responses will help us determine the next steps in our process.

Nassau Psychology is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $32.50 - $52.50 per hour

* Professional development assistance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Do you have experience working with children?
* Which current license do you have?

- LCSW, LMHC, LMSW, MHC-LP?

title: Campus Recruiter
description:
Lead Advisor, LLC is a wealth management consulting and search firm. This role is for one of our clients. Visit other wealth management focused roles at jobs.lead-advisor.com

**Overview**

With direction from a higher-level recruiting role or Managing Partner/Managing Director/Chief Development Officer, the Campus Recruiter is responsible for district network office or network office campus recruitment and selection efforts. This role will execute office recruiting plans to reach selection process activity and intern contract and conversion goals. Critical competencies in this position include: interpersonal savvy, priority setting, strong verbal and written communication skills, and drive for results.

**Primary Responsibilities:**

Sourcing

* Build and develop effective referral sources:

- In-office: current and former interns, FRs, staff, leaders

- On-campus: COIs, professors, department heads, athletics, career services, student organizations

* Actively participate in campus clubs and organizations to promote and brand company
* Coordinate advertising and marketing strategies on campus including the career services website, online job postings and advertising to include ads, direct mail, community events, etc.
* Develop relationships with other company recruiters to share leads and best practices
* Prepare and maintain recruiting and marketing materials
* Determine, schedule and coordinate on-campus recruiting activities

Selection

* Specific selection process accountability to include but not limited to screening candidates, conducting initial interviews, administering selection tools and guiding candidates through the selection process
* Review resumes and schedule initial interviews
* Communicate effectively about information and language regarding all aspects of the financial representative career and each step of the selection process

Accountability, Tracking, and Analysis

* Report weekly campus recruiting activity to leadership team
* Develop proficiency and use of home office-supported software to maintain candidate databases and accurate records of prospects to ensure efficiency of the selection process
* Assist in the coordination of leadership team meetings and the preparation of activity/results reports
* Analyze recruiting ratios to identify inefficiencies in selection process; establish and implement improvements
* May include the oversight of contract and licensing responsibilities

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree preferred
* 1-3 years professional work experience, preferably in sales, recruiting, or related field
* Experience in the financial services industry a plus
* Demonstrated ability to work professionally as a team member and with all levels of people
* Experience with prospecting; generating leads via phone or face-to-face interactions preferred
* Demonstrated knowledge of sourcing platforms (LinkedIn, Indeed, Handshake)
* Strong network of personal/professional advocates and campus relationships

**Location:** Hybrid in Midtown Office (3x a week in person, 2x remote)

**Salary:** 52-62k base

**Lead-Advisor, LLC is a Wealth Management Consulting and Search Firm. We help Fortune 500 firms, independent RIAs and solo-practitioners identify talent for their hiring needs. We help wealth management professionals upgrade their careers and find new opportunities.** 

**For more resources and information please visit www.lead-advisor.com.**

title: Medical Assistant - Primary Care outpatient - White Plains
description:
Sun River Health provides the highest quality of comprehensive primary, preventative and behavioral health services to all who see it, regardless of insurance status and ability to pay, especially for the underserved and vulnerable. Sun River Health is a Federally Qualified, Non-Profit Health Center serving communities in Suffolk, Rockland, Orange, Dutchess, Ulster, Sullivan, Columbia and Westchester County. Sun River Health is currently seeking a full-time Medical Assistant to join our team in White Plains, NY.

A Medical Assistant helps patients and the clinical team at designated health center in support of medical care as directed by the nursing and medical staff and pursuant to the objectives and policies of the Center. This position performs job duties in compliance with systems and job specific standards and additional jobs or duties assigned.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

* Completes the rooming process and takes vital signs, vision, and/or hearing tests, record patient data in eCW, (laboratory results, pain level, PEAS, PhQ, Smoke status, etc.) Document reason for visit and ensure CVR’s are completed as needed.
* Perform in-house labs, perform quality control and maintenance of equipment in accordance with organizational protocols.
* Draws blood and collects other specimens as directed by providers and processes accordingly.
* Conducts routine tests in areas such as serology, hematology, chemistry, histology and cytology using standard techniques and equipment. Collect specimens for out-side labs (ex. Pap, cultures, etc.).
* Prepare exam room and any needed equipment and assists/chaperones during examination and treatment of patients.
* Keeps clinical area stocked and in good order. Assures that all dated material is kept current and disposes of outdated supplies.
* Cleans and sterilizes all equipment and logs according to organizational policy and/or manufactures guidelines.
* Perform basic clerical work in service area; answer phones in appropriate manner, communicate problems/concerns to nurse; handle telephone inquiries.
* Ensures all appropriate logs are maintained. Keeps records for laboratory tests.
* Performs EKGs.

Minimum Education Requirement: High School diploma/ GED with Medical Assistant Training Certificate  
Preferred Education Requirement: Associate's degree with Medical Assistant Training Certificate  
Preferred Related Work Experience: 1 year

Sun River Health is a network of over 40 Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs) providing primary, dental, pediatric, OB-GYN, and behavioral health care to over 245,000 patients annually. With a dedicated staff of 2,000 doctors, nurses, and health care professionals, we pride ourselves on delivering high-quality, affordable care to those who need it most. Sun River Health started in 1975 when four African American mothers spearheaded efforts to open our first health center in Peekskill, New York to deliver accessible, high-quality, affordable services to patients in need no matter their race, religion, income, or insurance status. Today, after 45 years of service, Sun River Health is still delivering on that promise to communities across the Hudson Valley, New York City, and Long Island.

title: 1:1 Teacher's Aide/Paraprofessional
description:
Manhattan Star Academy, a member of the YAI Network, provides Elementary Education for students 3-21 years of age with intellectual developmental disabilities and learning delays, including children on the autism spectrum.

Our mission is to provide high-quality services to children and their families in a comprehensive, developmentally based program which focuses on the whole child. Instructional activities integrate all the domains of child development, including physical development and health, and social/emotional development; communication, language, and literacy; cognition and knowledge of the world (math, science, social studies, the arts and technology). Our program strives to foster growth and development through a broad range of services within the program while utilizing community resources as appropriate.

Join us in working in a friendly environment that facilitates open communication and participatory management, where you are valued as a professional and where your opinion truly matters. Receive on-going state-of-the-art training, supportive supervision and a commitment to developing your education and career to help you reach your greatest potential as a professional!

title: RN PreOp/PACU FT
description:
**Somerset Ambulatory Surgical Center** has an immediate need for a full time PreOp/PACU RN! At Somerset Ambulatory Surgical Center, we focus on offering a high quality, service oriented environment for your surgical procedure. Our facility is accredited by Accreditation Association for Ambulatory Health Care.

  


**Job Summary:** The RN Pre-op/PACU is a Registered Nurse that provides quality patient care using the nursing process, the medical plan of care, and organizational policies. The RN Pre-op/PACU provides safe, effective, and quality patient-family centered care in the perioperative services for all patient populations. The RN Pre-op/PACU supports the mission, vision, and values of the organization.

  


**Who We Are**

At USPI, we create relationships that create better care. We partner with physicians and health care systems to provide first class ambulatory solutions throughout the United States. We are committed to providing surgical services in the most efficient and clinically excellent manner.  



USPI is committed to, and proud of our inclusive culture. An inclusive culture, in our view, is respectful of differences and nurtures and supports the contributions of each individual, while also embracing and leveraging diversity. A diverse workforce, combined with an inclusive culture, makes USPI stronger and better able to meet the needs of our diverse patient and physician population.  



For more information about USPI, check out our **website** **Required Skills:*** Active Registered Nurse license in the state of New Jersey.


* Current CPR, ACLS, PALS required.


* Graduate of an accredited school of nursing


* Minimum 2 years of experience in Pre-Op/PACU or Critical Care. Experience working in an ASC is a plus.


* Ability to recognize, evaluate, solve problems and correct errors.


* Excellent communication and organizational skills.


* Demonstrates accountability, professionalism, openness, receptive to change, creativity and innovative.


* Ability to adapt to change quickly, strong knowledge base relative to surgery procedures and management of the surgical patient


* Understands principles of aseptic technique and their implementation


* Excellent teaching skills


* Basic knowledge of Performance Improvement ideology


* Must be an excellent team player and have the ability to communicate with staff, patients and physicians.

  


*USPI complies with federal, state, and/or local laws regarding mandatory vaccination of its workforce. If you are offered this position and must be vaccinated under any applicable law, you will be required to show proof of full vaccination or obtain an approval of a religious or medical exemption prior to your start date. If you receive an exemption from the vaccination requirement, you will be required to submit to regular testing in accordance with the law.*  



#LI-CT1

title: Massage Therapy Instructor
description:
**Primary Location:**

Red Bank New Jersey

We are searching for candidates that meet the required qualifications and experience and are able to perform the essential duties and responsibilities.

**Job Summary:**

Provide program coordination and management for a Massage Therapy program, including staffing, facility and resource/equipment management and inventory control, program promotion, accreditation preparation and compliance, curriculum development and revision, course instruction, instructor evaluation, clinical site management, student and application management, and compliance with state regulations.

**Required Qualifications:**

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

· Supervision, management, and administration of the day-to-day activities of the program.

· Align the program with accreditation standards and state compliance regulations; work closely with accrediting body and state licensing agency.

· Teach assigned classes if needed, with sufficient non-instructional time to effectively fulfill administrative and compliance duties.

· Curriculum design, curriculum assessment, instructional supervision, and instructional evaluation.

· Maintain current awareness of the field through professional development specific to the program.

· Responsible for budget development and management; maintenance of adequate resources and institutional support for the program. Participate in the financial planning and management of the program to ensure net revenue goals are met or exceeded.

· Serve as the primary contact for students, instructors, and staff.

· Recruit, interview, and recommend the hiring of instructors and staff for the program.

· Promote the program through internal and external sources and through social media.

· Assist with managing the student admission, advisement, progression, completion, certification and licensing process for the program. Assist in facilitating and resolving student complaints/concerns in a constructive, fair, and balanced manner, following our program’s core values while working with instructors, students, and staff.

**Supplemental Functions**

· Perform other duties as assigned.

· Perform all duties and maintain all standards in accordance with our school policies, procedures and Core Values.

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**

· Knowledge of the massage therapy industry

· Knowledge of the requirements for certifications (hours and skills)

· Knowledge of clinical requirements

· Knowledge and fluency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Adobe Acrobat

· Critical thinking skills

· Organizational skills

· Verbal and written communication skills

· Decision making and problem-solving skills

· Ability to work independently as well as part of a team

· Ability to work and effectively communicate with a diverse group of constituents, including college officials, faculty, students, business and industry providers

· Ability to compile, manage, and interpret data

· Ability to assess project management needs

· Ability to maintain a positive attitude and outlook while prioritizing and multitasking under pressure amid deadlines

· Ability to maintain discretion and confidentiality

**Physical Demands, Working Conditions and Physical Effort**  
Light Work - Exerting up to 20 pounds of force occasionally, up to 10 pounds of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly having to move objects. If the use of arm and/or leg controls requires exertion of forces greater than that for the Sedentary Work category and the worker sits most of the time, the job is rated Light Work. Positions in this class typically include talking, hearing, seeing, grasping, standing, walking and repetitive motions, plus stooping, kneeling, crouching, and reaching. Relatively free from unpleasant environmental conditions or hazards. Office environment. Occasional physical effort required.

**Requirements**  
Associate degree in a related field from an accredited institution is required. Bachelor’s degree in a related field from an accredited institution, preferred.  
Five (5) years of experience as a licensed massage therapist is required.  
Two (2) years of supervisory experience.

*Licenses and Certifications*  
Current active licensure as a massage therapy instructor in the State of New Jersey.

title: Business Development Associate
description:
**About IDR:**

IDR is a tech-enabled platform of over 500,000+ industry leaders across multiple verticals and geographies. We connect consulting firms, life science firms, financial institutions, and corporate clients with vetted subject matter experts to make the right decision.

**The Role:**

The Business Development Associate will be responsible for identifying and developing new business opportunities, fostering strong client relationships, and collaborating with internal teams to deliver expert insights and solutions.

**What You'll Do**

* Conduct market research to identify potential clients and industry trends.
* Develop and implement strategies to target and acquire new clients.
* Outreach to new prospective client organizations via email, phone, and creative social media campaigns for new account acquisition.
* Assist in the onboarding process for new clients, ensuring a smooth transition and integration of services. You will schedule the meetings and join the meetings too so you can be involved in the entire process.
* Continuously engage with clients to provide updates, gather feedback, and offer additional services as needed.
* Grow existing client relationships.
* Develop a playbook and best practices.

**You're an Ideal fit if:**

· You enjoy doing things in a non-traditional way and think out of the box.

· You can adapt to a fast-paced environment and have a positive attitude with a focus on results.

· You have an excellent commitment to confidentiality and responsibility with highly sensitive information.

· Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build and maintain lasting client relationships.

· You have immaculate attention to detail.

· You're open to collaboration to get things done, and you try to bring your best to everything you do.

**Requirements:**

· Fresh graduates (June 2024) or 6 months to 3 years of experience on the sales or account management side.

· Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.

· Highly motivated with a strong desire to achieve and exceed targets.

· Ambitious and results-oriented with a focus on continuous improvement.

· Ability to quickly learn and articulate the company’s services and capabilities.

**What do we offer?**

* Monday – Thursday in the NY office with WFH Fridays.

title: Early Childhood Soccer Instructor
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Positive work environment
* Competitive salary
* Flexible schedule
* Free uniforms
* Opportunity for advancement
* Training & development

  

**Our Company:**  

If you have a passion for soccer and want to positively impact children’s lives, then let’s connect today! Soccer Shots is an engaging children’s soccer program with a focus on character development. We offer a Traditional Program to meet the developmental needs of children ages 2-8. We also offer an Empower Program, which provides children with disabilities a safe place to learn and grow and have fun with the game of soccer. With 10 plus years’ experience, we serve children in Morris, Hunterdon, Somerset, Middlesex, Mercer, Ocean, Atlantic, Cape May, Cumberland, and Salem Counties. Our vision is to provide a beloved growth experience for every child, a remarkable experience for every family. We maintain a caring and family work culture.  

  

**Job Description:**  

 We are looking for part-time instructors in all counties for both our Traditional and Empower Programs to introduce kids ages 2-8 to the game of soccer through clinic style play. We offer a competitive rate per session of $15-$30 based on experience with opportunities of advancement. Our seasons run 10-12 weeks, with the option of working all year round.  

  

**What you get:**  

* Flexible scheduling according to your availability and based on what sessions are needed
* Weekday mornings/early evenings and weekend mornings are all available
* Great Company Culture and Growth Potential
* Thorough training and curriculum provided
* Uniform and equipment necessary to coach


  

**Requirements:**  

* Transportation-you are responsible for getting to and from the location of the session
* Soccer experience preferred but not mandatory
* Caring, engaging each child through positive affirmation
* Energetic by creating a fun and exciting atmosphere that leads a child to smile and


 participate.

title: Elementary School Teacher
description:
**Elementary Classroom Teacher (K-2)**

**Position Purpose** Under the general supervision of the School Director, to facilitate student success and growth in academic and interpersonal skills through implementing district-approved curriculum; documenting teaching and student progress/activities/outcomes; addressing specific educational needs of individual students and by creating a flexible, safe and optimal learning environment; and providing feedback to students, parents and administration regarding student progress, expectations, goals, etc

**Essential Functions**

* Develops and administers school elementary curriculum consistent with school district goals and objectives.
* Promotes a classroom environment that is safe and conducive to individualized and small group instruction, and student learning.
* Develops lesson plans and instructional materials and translates lesson plans into learning experiences to develop pertinent sequential assignments, challenge students, and best utilize the available time for instruction.
* Conducts ongoing assessment of student learning and progress, and modifies instructional methods to fit individual student's needs, including students with special needs.
* Maintains anecdotal notes for students and collaborates with administration regarding issues & concerns.
* Maintains familiarity with district and New Jersey State standardized tests for the purpose of adapting curriculum to maximize student achievement on such tests.
* Continues to acquire professional knowledge and learn of current developments in the educational field by attending seminars, workshops or professional meetings, or by conducting research.
* Organizes and maintains a system for accurate and complete record-keeping, grading, and reporting for all student activities, achievement and attendance as required by district procedures and applicable laws.
* Maintains open communication with parents via Class Dojo, phone calls, emails, and parent teacher conferences.
* Ensures that student conduct conforms to the school's standards and school district policies, and establishes and maintains standards of student behavior needed to achieve a functional learning atmosphere in the classroom.
* Coordinates with other professional staff members, especially within grade level, and participates in faculty meetings and committees.
* Selects and requisitions appropriate books, instructional aids and other supplies and equipment and maintains inventory records.
* Provide struggling students with additional after school support within contracted times.

**Additional Duties** Performs other related tasks as assigned by the School Director, Curriculum Supervisor, Project Coordinator, and other central office administrators as designated by the Superintendent.

**Note:** The above description is illustrative of tasks and responsibilities. It is not meant to be all inclusive of every task or responsibility.

**Equipment** Uses standard office equipment such as personal computers, printer, copy and fax machines, Smartboard and accessories, ipads, and telephone.

**Travel Requirements** Travels to school district buildings and professional meetings as required.

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**

* Knowledge of current teaching methods and educational pedagogy, as well as differentiates instruction based upon student learning styles.
* Knowledge of elementary school curriculum and concepts.
* Knowledge of data information systems, data analysis and the formulation of action plans.
* Knowledge of Smartboard functions and tools.
* Knowledge of effective classroom management plans and procedures.
* Knowledge of applicable federal and state laws regarding education and students.
* Ability to use computer network system and software applications as needed.
* Ability to organize and coordinate work.
* Ability to communicate effectively with students and parents.
* Ability to engage in self-evaluation with regard to performance and professional growth.
* Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with others contacted in the course of work.

**Physical and Mental Demands, Work Hazards**

Works in standard office and school building environments.

**Note:** Also see the Summary of Physical, Sensory and Environmental Requirements Needed to Perform Essential Job Duties for this position.

**Qualifications Profile** Certification/License:

* New Jersey State Certification, Elementary School Teacher Grades K-6 or Pre-K-3

**Education**

* Bachelors from an accredited college or university in Elementary Education.
* Masters Degree in related area preferred.

**Experience**

Successful prior teaching experience for the appropriate grade levels a plus.

description:
United States - New Jersey
Business management, administration and support
Global Wealth Management
**Job Reference #**


302305BR
**City**


Short Hills
**Job Type**


Full Time
**Your role**


Are you truly service oriented? Do you know how to take care of people?  

  

We’re looking for a Client Associate to:  

  

* keep management systems up-to-date with client information
* educate clients on account services and capabilities
* help with the preparation of reports and other materials for client meetings
* collect the right documentation for opening new accounts and service requests
* plan team marketing events and maintain marketing materials
* provide the team with a detailed calendar of activities

**Your team**


You'll be working closely with teams in Short Hills, NJ. As a Client Associate, you will play an important role supporting Financial Advisors along with assisting their clients with administrative needs.
**Your expertise**


* series 7 and 66 licenses, is preferred, but not necessary at the time of hire.
* ideally 3-5 years of experience in client service, within the finance sector
* ideally a college degree, focusing on finance/banking
* excellent communicator, with solid interpersonal skills
* detail oriented (nothing gets past you)
* proficient in Microsoft Office Suite


**About us**


UBS is the world’s largest and the only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors..  

  

We have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries.
**How we hire**


We may request you to complete one or more assessments during the application process. Learn more
**Join us**


At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.  

  

From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?

UBS Business Solutions SA  

UBS Recruiting

title: Barista/Cashier (Tanger Outlets)
description:
***Are you passionate about bubble tea businesses?***

***Are you a person who always thrive to grow and accomplish more?***

***If Yes, join us Today!***

***If it's not now, When?***

***If it's not me, Who?***

Originated in Toronto, 2002, Real Fruit Bubble Tea has been committed to making fresh fruit drinks, healthy and accessible for anyone to enjoy. We now have 103 locations in Canada and USA. As a super fast-growing business, we want you to join our team in our Short Hill location and grow with us, and we will build you up from Barista to Store manager to Regional Manager and beyond!!! **There is huge potential for growth and we welcome anyone who is up to a challenging yet rewarding journey!!**

**Position Description**

As a Cashier/Barista at Real Fruit Bubble Tea, you represent and embody the values and beliefs of the company when delivering the best customer service and quality hand-crafted drinks that Real Fruit is known for.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

· Provide exceptional customer service; Identifies customer issues and/or complaints and handles them in a professional manner

· Prepares every drink in accordance with Real Fruit's drinks formula and preparation techniques. Tastes all drinks to ensure that they meet Real Fruit's high-quality standards

· Performs daily opening/closing procedures in accordance with Real Fruit's standards

· Maintains the cleanliness of the store

· Helps with the preparation to drinks to facilitate the smooth and efficient operations of the store

· Shows initiative to assist Management with floor controls and inventory control by monitoring reorder points and taking inventory counts

· Can work through a variety of shifts and maintain a high-energy level

· Demonstrates professionalism at all times Is aware of and works towards Store goals

· Perform other related duties upon request.

**Ideal Candidate Competencies**

* **Attitude:** proven entrepreneur spirit of working "on-floor" spontaneously, as to motivate and propel the frontline personnel in person and to serve as the role model for co-workers
* **Results-Oriented:** demonstrates the ability to consistently perform optimal business results by meeting deadlines and achieving pre-determined goals
* **Communication:** effectively conveys necessary information and ideas in concise and meaningful exchanges through verbal and written communications
* **Teamwork/Collaboration**: effectively develops healthy relationships with co-workers and encourages idea-sharing that assists to accomplish goals
* **Initiative:** proactively seeking opportunities to work outside of job scope to assist various business departments and demonstrates the ability to always go beyond what is required to achieve goals
* **Personal Adaptability:** demonstrates the ability to welcome and embrace changes and effectively adjusts to newly altered environment within the business

**Expectation of Successful Candidate**

· Work well in a team environment as an effective team member

· Able to complete job responsibilities without direct supervision

· Understand the importance of customer service and is customer-focused

· Possess excellent communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills

· Demonstrate strong work ethics: responsible, reliable, punctual, and have high integrity

· Able to work in a fast-paced environment; strong hands-on skills

· Is detail-oriented

· Having similar prior experiences is an asset

If you possess the above qualifications and desire to learn and accomplish more in a welcoming and dynamic organization then you are what we are looking for. Selected candidates will be contacted for an interview.

Real Fruit Bubble Tea Inc. is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employers that do not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, religion, age, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, provincial or federal laws, rules, or regulations. RFBT's policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment.

* Night shift

* Customer service: 1 year (Required)

title: Investment Consultant - Stamford, CT
description:
**Your opportunity**
--------------------

 *At Schwab,* *you’re* *empowered to make an impact on your career. Here, innovative thought meets creative problem solving, helping us “challenge the status quo” and transform the finance industry together.*


As an Investment Consultant (IC) at Schwab, you have the opportunity to learn and grow within our Branch Network at the ground floor. The first foray into the path towards becoming a Financial Consultant (FC) at Schwab, the IC role provides the exposure and experience required to advance in this challenging space. You’ll learn what it takes to build a book of business through proactive, outbound calls to existing Schwab clients, uncovering opportunities through needs-based analysis and positioning appropriate products and solutions. You’ll observe our skilled FCs and learn how to deliver unparalleled value and service through collaboration and mentoring. If you are seeking the first step towards a rich and rewarding career in financial consulting, look no further than Schwab’s Investment Consultant role.

**What you have**
-----------------

  

* **Required Qualifications:**
* A valid and active Series 7 license is required (license may be obtained under a condition of employment through Branch Network Licensing Program)
* A valid and active Series 66 (63/65) license required (license(s) may be obtained under a condition of employment)
* A valid and active Life and Health Insurance license is required (may be obtained under a condition of employment)

  

* 
* **Preferred Qualifications:**
* 2 years of experience in the financial services industry
* Ability to leverage Business development experience
* Passion for gaining knowledge of brokerage/banking products and services
* Openness to build strong client relationships

 **In addition to the salary range, this role is also eligible for bonus or incentive opportunities.****What’s in it for you**
------------------------


At Schwab, we’re committed to empowering our employees’ personal and professional success. Our purpose-driven, supportive culture, and focus on your development means you’ll get the tools you need to make a positive difference in the finance industry. Our Hybrid Work and Flexibility approach balances our ongoing commitment to workplace flexibility, serving our clients, and our strong belief in the value of being together in person on a regular basis.


We offer a competitive benefits package that takes care of the whole you – both today and in the future:

* 401(k) with company match and Employee stock purchase plan
* Paid time for vacation, volunteering, and 28-day sabbatical after every 5 years of service for eligible positions
* Paid parental leave and family building benefits
* Tuition reimbursement
* Health, dental, and vision insurance

title: Supervisor, District (3)
description:

At Liberty Coca-Cola, we strive to make our workforce as inclusive and diverse as the communities we serve. Our associates are our #1 asset, and we are committed to investing in our people, maintaining the highest safety standards, and creating a culture of growth and innovation. We offer competitive compensation and benefit packages to full-time, regular associates, including: Medical, Dental, Vision, Prescription drug plans, 401K with company contributions, paid vacation, company paid holidays, and more.
